meanings.definition: Having a hand clenched into a fist.
meanings.sent1: He had a fisted hand ready to punch.
meanings.sent2: Her fisted grip on the rope was strong.
meanings.sent3: The fisted glove made it hard to hold the pen.
meanings.sent4: The fisted clouds signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The fisted gesture showed his determination.

meanings.definition: To hit with a closed hand.
meanings.sent1: He fisted the door in frustration.
meanings.sent2: She fisted the punching bag with all her might.
meanings.sent3: The boxer fisted the air playfully during warm-up.
meanings.sent4: She fisted her anger into the pillow.
meanings.sent5: He fisted the table to emphasize his point.

meanings.definition: To grip tightly with the hand.
meanings.sent1: She fisted the fabric to keep it from slipping.
meanings.sent2: He fisted the handle of the suitcase firmly.
meanings.sent3: The child fisted the toy tightly, not wanting to let go.
meanings.sent4: The roots fisted around the rock in the soil.
meanings.sent5: He fisted the rope to climb up the tree.
